title: APG Actions Menu Button Example Using aria-activedescendant
description: This example demonstrates how the menu button design pattern can be used to create a button that opens an actions menu. Note: not all features present in this example are tested, as they are tested elsewhere in this project.

activate the menu button, and focus will be sent to the target (menu)

safari.notes: tab to the button with it collapsed
safari.output: "actions, menu popup button, You are currently on a button. To display a list of options, press Control-Option-Space."

safari.output: "actions, menu popup button, You are currently on a menu item. To choose this item, press Control-Option-Space. To close this menu, press Escape."

results.notes: implied by looping back to the top of the menu

history.message: Update JAWS support for aria-controls. JAWS 2020 no longer has a setting to convey the presence of the attribute.
Added Narrator results for NVDA and JAWS, updated NVDA+Chrome results.
Retested with VoiceOver. No major changes.
Updated results and version support for NVDA, JAWS, Narrator, and VoiceOver for Chrome, Edge, Firefox, and Safari desktop.
